result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark J. Anderson

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM  Atty Dolch makes further argument re: her motion to modify bond.  State asks that the cash bond remained noting nonappearances in 21CF701.  Atty Dolch responds noting DE would have work available to him if released and is still on supervision through DOC.  Court denies the request for bond modification.
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on September 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Return date on September 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark J. Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for Mark J. Anderson.  Court states cases and appearances.  DE rec'd complaint in 22CF448.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in that case.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt.  Court advises DE of his right to counsel.  Court asks for explanation for nonappearance in 21CF701 noting there is also a BFH set for tomorrow at 1pm.  Atty Hayes has no record to make re: nonappearance by DE for his prelim.  Court will not reinstate the cash bond.  State asks for an additional $1,000 cash in 21CF701 and $1,000 in 22CF448 w/conditions.  Off the record victim's name are stated.  Atty Hayes makes her bail argument.  Court sets bonds.  $750 cash bond is forfeited in 21CF701.  Time limits waived for PH in 22CF448.  

21CF701 - $1,000.00 cash bond set - Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/P.L.K. or her residence or her place of employment or any other location where she may be located
Prelim set for  9/22 at 11:15 a.m..

22CF448 - $500.00 cash bond set - Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact A.M.N. or E.D.N. or their residence.  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No possession of alcohol.  No bars/taverns/liquor stores.
Return Date on 9/22/22 at 11:15 a.m. to track w/21CF701.
Return date scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Return date on September 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.
